intro: Miliusa indica var. strigosa, commonly known as the hairy miliusa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including India and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage, which gives it its common name. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture due to the presence of fine hairs.
